mentions.context: We use the standard Weka implementation with 𝑘=10 [51] .
We can also mention ToxAlerts, a web-based platform that collects toxicophores from the literature [15] .
In another approach, MOLPRINT2D [45] , each heavy atom in a structure is characterized by an environment that consists of all other heavy atoms within a distance of two bonds.
We use the J48 implementation from Weka with standard parameters.
We use the Naïve Bayes classifier as implemented in Weka [53] .

The other undefined MCS (1421) is more of interest because this unambigous substructure is not reported on ToxAlerts [15] , an open expertknowledge-based platform that contains more than 3000 toxicophores from the literature for several endpoints including mutagenicity (117).
We use the Repeated Incremental Pruning to Produce Error Reduction (RIPPER) algorithm [52] (as implemented in Weka) with standard parameters.
In order to compare the different fingerprint methods, we used them as features in five different machine learning methods from the Weka [47] data mining tool:
